title: Need Typeface suggestion?
content:
Can I get some suggestions on a couple typefaces when you think of the words “Aztec” and “Mexico”? One direction I’m looking into is using the Aztec pictogram ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-mexican-relics/p22-mexican-relics/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222326/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-mexican-relics/p22-mexican-relics/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-mexican-relics/p22-mexican-relics/"))and some type that would go with it. The other direction is just getting the feeling of the mexican culture.

 [‹ Identity and stationary - book suggestions](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222326/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37129 "Go to previous forum topic") [InDesign Black Output on PDF Export ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222326/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31345 "Go to next forum topic")
author: heymendoza

comments.content:
I would go with researching the feeling of the Mexican culture. Mexico has a lot of culture and to be represented by pictograms may be appropriate in some instances but may be like putting boots on a Texan who lives in the city.

[http://www.visitmexico.com/work/sites/Visitmexico/resources/Banner/13585...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102222326/http:/www.visitmexico.com/work/sites/Visitmexico/resources/Banner/13585/logo.gif "http://www.visitmexico.com/work/sites/Visitmexico/resources/Banner/13585/logo.gif")
